values:
I decided to save a barn cat by taking her to get neutered.  Now she's living with me until her opening heals up.  I am thinking about keeping her, but the dog continues to look at her like a squirrel and not like a pack member.  Anyone who owns animals and takes good care of them medically should never complain about human health and insurance.  There are times I wish the pets had insurance and all I had to pay was a 5-25 dollar copay.  

The eee pc is still in kiddie mode.  I went to a Ron Paul event last night instead of putting my Eee into advanced mode.  Forgive me techies.  I promise to do it tonight.  Today I will test the battery life.  Last night we did fix the home connectivity problem.  Nicholas re-entered the mac address and the computer connected just fine.  It was human error.  So, now I can report that the Eee connects beautifully everywhere so far.  A warning about the keyboard is due.  The right keys are not exactly where they should be.  It's not a major change, but it does require new muscle memory to not hit enter when you're going for the shift.  Also, if you have fat fingers you may have a problem with the keyboard.  If you have narrow fingers or small hands you're good.  The screen is 7" but the font is the same size as any computer.  This machine will probably not help you improve your posture.  The games are fun =) But then, I like penguins.

I need charles's email.  Charles or someone who knows his email please respond.  I may be coming to freeload off of visit you this spring. 

Chacmool is a good conference, though a bit poorly run.  I sat next to Pam Crabtree on the flight from Minneapolis to Calgary.  EEEh.  I met some other very neat people.  Like Christine Hastorf or Ian Hodder's wife.  Yep.  That was pretty awesome.  She's a character.  But, perhaps best of all, I met some cool people going to school in Vancouver.  I might be going to SAA after all. 

For those of you who ever want to study feasting or reciprocity in depth you will read at least four names: Mauss, Dietler, Hayden and Goody.  Hayden teaches in Vancouver.  According to his students he is very shy except in his safe world or his office.  There he is not so afraid and he will often call you in to chat while wearing penis sandals that flop as he shakes his foot on resting on his knee.  Think of it what you will.

Washing Regalo is my biggest accomplishment today.  It took a while and Nicholas did have a boring role to play, but Regalo is now shiny and has had both his mane and tail brushed.  Brushing the tail took a while.  It is about 4' and quite thick and had formed into ringlets.  He is now quite the envy of quarter horse owners =) He almost looks like a show horse.  I am pleased.  

Finally bought my plane ticket and booked my hotel for the Chacmool Conference.  Now, to write the paper.
In follow up to David's post, it looks like things are improving for Youssif.

I have a theory as to why it is common for female students to sleep with their graduate advisers.  Women sexually peak around their early to mid twenties, which is also when most women are in graduate program.  Add this biological fact with the social atmosphere, expectations and a shared interest and close working conditions...one can see how this happens.  Fortunately, that is not an issue in our department.

Does anyone know what strangles is?  Let me enlighten you.  It is  Streptococcus equi.  That's correct.  Strep throat for horses.  Except when this stuff spreads it is not scarlet fever, but bastard strangles.  The symptoms include rope-like yellow mucus from nose, fever and glandular swelling near throat.  The swelling can be so bad as to choke the horse or make it extremely uncomfortable to eat and drink.  Bastard strangles can be fatal.  Oh, and all this loveliness is very contagious.  All of this is very relevant in my life right now as my horse has strangles.  Fortunately he only has one symptom and that is the swollen glands and  even those are not very swollen.  But it still means a month of isolation and a month of force feeding a 900lb animal SMZs.  Perhaps next summer Regalo will make it through with out any illnesses.  I'll spare you the drama that has resulted from this and from two girls especially, that have more money than sense and I like to refer to as harpies.  =D

Dr. Murray and I were discussing the sacrificial practices of the Celts.  Sacrifices ranged from livestock to humans.  Warriors often rode with heads of their enemies tied on their mounts.  He then went on to criticize Cunliffe for stating that Celts were just like us.  Perhaps most Americans and most British people no longer practice acts of such brutality for religion or to show success in battle, but when one considers the brutality of many modern conflicts the Celts don't seem so foreign.

I am on a new sleep schedule.  I work all night and sleep from 2-7pm.  Yep...

Hopefully this will change soon.  I must read 58 pages and write two pages now.

That's it.  I'm going to stop watching pro football game I might actually care about.  DAMN it!  First the Cowboys and now the Giants.  Fuck.  I definately can't watch the Saints game now.  C'mon Saints!

If you like the money you have and you like keeping as much as possible there is a more practical option than joining the Libertarian Party.  ING is the google of banks.  No overdraft fees.  Free online bill pay, including checks to your landlord.  I love them.  

Ok...well, after examining the website, it seems you must first have a savings account now to sign up for checking.  But, their savings accounts are really good too.

ArcGIS is not ALWAYS user friendly, esp when trying to create a new shapefile.  Naturally, our book is designed to give a survey of GIS technology and theory.  Yes, GIS is based on theory.  Isn't everything?  So, the help button or our professors have to explain how to do things. 

I think the library and J-Stor are in cahoots to stop me from working on this project.  Most journals I need to search are not covered by J-Stor, but the one that is will not find the review I know it has.  The Library does not have subscriptions to many of the Journals that contain reviews I need and so even if I do find them, I can't access them b/c I don't have a subscription.  This is insanely frustrating.  Law students...think Lexis-Nexis and searching for cases but not always being able to access the full thing. 

In the world of .pdf and online archives, finding articles should not be this hard.  And now I will quit complaining.

EDIT:  I was, um, searching for chapter names apparently and not titles as I should have.  Oops.

For my Starbucks loving friends in Canada =)  

            Are you prepared for Phase 2? 

             No word on what they're planning in Canada, yet.

Well, it is that wonderful fall month that has the one day you can dress up in whatever fashion you wish!  For some ideas, incase you're getting a late start like me: 

http://naboo-girl.deviantart.com/gallery/artisan/textiles/

Very cool stuff.  Then Butterick is also having a pattern sale.

I'm presently taking up valuable computer space in the library.  I am soon to start writing my two page paper for Dr. Murray.  As much as I enjoy this reading course I never seem to finish the works on time.  Shame on me!  Hopefully this will change within the next two weeks (our next meeting after this one).  Yay for VG Childe.  

We're house sitting this weekend then Monday we move back into our place and we get to bring Chorni with us this time.  I'm really looking forward to having him home with us.  This weekend I plan to straighten up our place as well as finish "Return to Laughter" and doing my GIS homework (take home read-the-damn-book-quiz).  We're starting the weekend off right with a trip to Target (Southaven) this afternoon.  This apartment is going to look like people live there!

Hi guys!  I know this is really late notice but we are having a brunch tomorrow morning from 10AM to well...when ever.  It will feature the classics plus bloody marys and mimosas.  Other drinks will also be available.  Please come by.  We're in the building accross from teh University Methodist church and next to Puddin Place.  It has a big development sign in the front yard.  Can't miss it! =)

I am drunk. I have been at Murphs since 7:20ish.  Nicholas just came in wiht muy chikan on a stick.  I am being forced to drink mor watwhile I contemplate the secrests relayed to me by my previously thought to be boyfriednd who is actually very female orienteted. OOPSjj!!   wow...I really nee dto eats oemthing before I throw up.   byebeye! Kids1

Mind Over Matter
You prefer 50 % Aggression and 78 % Cunning!
Verily, I say! Thou hast proven thyself to be a most beguiling opponent! However, thou hast not proven thyself an angry man, as thou hast shewn theyself to prefer intellegence over mere brawn. A classic mind-over-matter type, I say. Thou art most likely to kill a man whilst he's missing on purpose, like Aaron Burr. A very clever ruse, no? But, of course, on the actual test, you probably choose Hamilton as the final victor of their duel, because he's the one everybody remembers. A cunning and complex distinction. You can most commonly be found drinking a Cafe Latte at the Museum gift shop, but I would recommend that you avoid NASCAR events like your life depends upon it. (It probably does.) My guess also is that you have a smart mouth that gets you in trouble and my futher advice is to say that mind over matter only really works for Professor Xavier.



My test tracked 2 variables How you compared to other people your age and gender:
You scored higher than 43% on Aggression
You scored higher than 78% on Intelligence
Link: The Fisticuffs Psychology Test written by Geiger on OkCupid, home of the 32-Type Dating Test
I love these guys!  I have a feeling I'll be quoting them in my cultural seminar class  =)

So the place we're moving into needs some bathroom repair around the tub.  A bad job was done previously and now little critters are crawling in.  I'm perfectly fine with showering at the turner center for a while but I would like it fixed.  The apt. manager hasn't had any luck finding someone (who knows how hard he's tried).  Does anyone (navydave - not the Jubilee navydave) do tile or tub repair?  Would you like some relatively easy cash?  

Does anyone have any experience with large numbers of red wasps?  I have a HUGE nest that needs destroying at the barn.  Any suggestions besides the obvious one (exterminator)?
Going to Blues club tonight.  Who wants to come???  call: you know the digits

Does anyone know of any local boarding facilities besides Oxford Equine Center (formerly known as Campbell's), Atkins Ranch, or Evie's (can't remember exact name of farm)?  I have to relocate my horse by January 1st 2007 because my barn will no longer be boarding (I'm the only one left boarding out there).  I have a while to look but I thought I'd ask around since most of these places don't advertise.

If more republicans were like this candidate I would be in the Republican party but as it turns out too many of them are bible-thumping moralists with no sense of reason here in the south. Oh and did I mention that most seem to be protectionist??? Well, the market is solving the second problem and hopefully more Mimis will solve the first.

So drinking coffee after work when you get off at 10PM is not wise unless you have a paper to finish.  I have no paper to finish so now I'm diligently (read: obcessively) checking LJ and gmail.  I'm also doing a face mask for the first time.  Yeah, I'm a little unfamiliar with the whole "beauty products" area.  Thought I'd try it since my face is being expose to large amounts of dust and sweat.  And what better else to do when a girl can't sleep?  

I know, the title hints that the post should be some sort of introspection and dealing with my putting on a "mask" in public to people.  However, unlike some peole I don't really have a set persona I try to convey.  So this is little more than a superficial facial mask post inspired by caffine.
